key_points: Over 400 ships were stranded due to the Ever Given blocking the Suez Canal.
61 remaining ships expected to clear the canal, ending the backlog.
The world's biggest shipping company, Maersk, warns of months to resolve disruptions.
Suez Canal Authority's chairman, Osama Rabie, said 85 ships will pass through on Saturday.
Clearing the backlog beat initial estimates by a couple of days.
Reopening the canal doesn't mark an immediate end to disruptions.
The ripple effects of the blockage could take months to unravel, according to Maersk.
The Ever Given was stuck for about 152 hours, causing an estimated $60 billion in total costs.
An ongoing investigation into the causes of the blockage is expected to conclude next week.
"The investigation is going well and will take two more days. Then we will announce the results," says Rabie.
